net.openhft.lang.sandbox.collection

Class ATSDirectBitSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.openhft.lang.sandbox.collection.ATSDirectBitSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.openhft.lang.ReferenceCounted, DirectBitSet

    public class ATSDirectBitSet
extends Object
implements DirectBitSet
    DirectBitSet with input validations and ThreadSafe memory access.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DirectBitSet and(long longIndex, long value)
      Performs a logical AND of the long at the specified index in this bit set with the argument long value.
      DirectBitSet andNot(long longIndex, long value)
      Clears all of the bits in the long at the specified index in this DirectBitSet whose corresponding bit is set in the specified long value.
      long cardinality()
      Returns the number of bits set to true in this DirectBitSet.
      DirectBitSet clear()
      Sets all of the bits in this BitSet to false.
      DirectBitSet clear(long bitIndex)
      Sets the bit specified by the index to false.
      DirectBitSet clear(long fromIndex, long exclusiveToIndex)
      Sets the bits from the specified fromIndex (inclusive) to the specified toIndex (exclusive) to false.
      DirectBitSet flip(long bitIndex)
      Sets the bit at the specified index to the complement of its current value.
      DirectBitSet flip(long fromIndex, long exclusiveToIndex)
      Sets each bit from the specified fromIndex (inclusive) to the specified toIndex (exclusive) to the complement of its current value.
      boolean get(long bitIndex)
      Returns the value of the bit with the specified index.
      long getLong(long longIndex)
      Returns the value of the long with the specified long index.

      Returns the index of the first bit that is set to true that occurs on or after the specified starting index.
      long nextSetLong(long fromLongIndex)
      Returns the index of the first long that contains a bit set to true that occurs on or after the specified starting index.

      Performs a logical OR of the long at the specified index in this bit set with the argument long value.

      • get

        public boolean get(long bitIndex)
        Description copied from interface: DirectBitSet
        Returns the value of the bit with the specified index. The value is true if the bit with the index bitIndex is currently set in this DirectBitSet; otherwise, the result is false.
        Specified by:
        get in interface DirectBitSet
        Parameters:
        bitIndex - the bit index
        Returns:
        the value of the bit with the specified index

      • nextSetBit

        public long nextSetBit(long fromIndex)
        Description copied from interface: DirectBitSet
        Returns the index of the first bit that is set to true that occurs on or after the specified starting index. If no such bit exists then -1 is returned.

        To iterate over the true bits in a DirectBitSet, use the following loop: 

         for (int i = bs.nextSetBit(0); i >= 0; i = bs.nextSetBit(i+1)) {
     // operate on index i here
 }
        Specified by:
        nextSetBit in interface DirectBitSet
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - the index to start checking from (inclusive)
        Returns:
        the index of the next set bit, or -1 if there is no such bit

      • nextSetLong

        public long nextSetLong(long fromLongIndex)
        Description copied from interface: DirectBitSet
        Returns the index of the first long that contains a bit set to true that occurs on or after the specified starting index. The index is the number of longs. If no such bit exists then -1 is returned.
        Specified by:
        nextSetLong in interface DirectBitSet
        Parameters:
        fromLongIndex - the index to start checking from (inclusive)
        Returns:
        the index of the next set long, or -1 if there is no such long

        public long nextClearBit(long fromIndex)
        Description copied from interface: DirectBitSet
        Returns the index of the first bit that is set to false that occurs on or after the specified starting index. If no such bit exists then -1 is returned.
        Specified by:
        nextClearBit in interface DirectBitSet
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - the index to start checking from (inclusive)
        Returns:
        the index of the next zeroOut bit, or -1 if there is no such bit

        Specified by:

      • previousSetBit

        public long previousSetBit(long fromIndex)
        Description copied from interface: DirectBitSet
        Returns the index of the nearest bit that is set to true that occurs on or before the specified starting index. If no such bit exists, or if -1 is given as the starting index, then -1 is returned.

        To iterate over the true bits in a DirectBitSet, use the following loop: 

         for (int i = bs.size(); (i = bs.previousSetBit(i-1)) >= 0; ) {
     // operate on index i here
 }
        Specified by:
        previousSetBit in interface DirectBitSet
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - the index to start checking from (inclusive)
        Returns:
        the index of the previous set bit, or -1 if there is no such bit

      • previousSetLong

        public long previousSetLong(long fromLongIndex)
        Description copied from interface: DirectBitSet
        Returns the index of the nearest long that contains a bit set to true that occurs on or before the specified starting index. If no such bit exists, or if -1 is given as the starting index, then -1 is returned.
        Specified by:
        previousSetLong in interface DirectBitSet
        Parameters:
        fromLongIndex - the index to start checking from (inclusive)
        Returns:
        the index of the previous long containing a set bit, or -1 if there is no such long

      • previousClearBit

        public long previousClearBit(long fromIndex)
        Description copied from interface: DirectBitSet
        Returns the index of the nearest bit that is set to false that occurs on or before the specified starting index. If no such bit exists, or if -1 is given as the starting index, then -1 is returned.
        Specified by:
        previousClearBit in interface DirectBitSet
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - the index to start checking from (inclusive)
        Returns:
        the index of the previous zeroOut bit, or -1 if there is no such bit

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • size

        public long size()
        Description copied from interface: DirectBitSet
        Returns the number of bits of space actually in use by this BitSet to represent bit values. The index of the last bit in the set eligible to be set or zeroOut is size() - 1.
        Specified by:
        size in interface DirectBitSet
        Returns:
        the number of bits in this bit set
